subject: Re: [junit] German book on Junit and test first ready for review
msgSnippet: ... IMO, the testing book wich has the most practical value to developers is the one by McGregor and Sykes; best of all: it s not even a third of Binder s
messageBody:
> Suggestions? Essentially all of the testing books I have ever read suck
> or don't cover object-oriented code using test first.

IMO, the testing book wich has the most practical value to developers is the
one by McGregor and Sykes; best of all: it's not even a third of Binder's
tome.

Johannes
